item.title: Expressing support for designation of November 2012 as Stomach Cancer Awareness Month.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

item.title: A resolution designating November 2012 as "Stomach Cancer Awareness Month" and supporting efforts to educate the public about stomach cancer.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. (text of measure as introduced: CR S5308)

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. (text of measure as introduced: CR S5078)

summary.text:
Designates November 2011 as Stomach Cancer Awareness Month.

Expresses support for efforts to educate the people of the United States about stomach cancer.

Recognizes the need for additional research into early diagnosis and treatment.

bill.title: A resolution designating November 2011 as "Stomach Cancer Awareness Month" and supporting efforts to educate the public about stomach cancer.

item.title: A resolution designating November 2011 as "Stomach Cancer Awareness Month" and supporting efforts to educate the public about stomach cancer.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
